content:
• Friday, February 10, 2012
  • TSM

    Leading chip foundry TSMC (TSM -3.1%) and smaller peer UMC (UMC -3.7%) both sold off after...

    Leading chip foundry TSMC (TSM -3.1%) and smaller peer UMC (UMC -3.7%) both sold off after posting their January sales reports (I, II). While TSMC's sales rose 11.4% M/M, they fell 1.1% Y/Y, and appear to have disappointed investors encouraged by recent signs of a chip industry bottom. The fact that many top chip developers rely on TSMC for manufacturing makes it a bellwether for broader industry demand.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:33 PM
  • TSLA

    Tesla Motors (TSLA -4.5%) sold off after the Street failed to be impressed by the unveiling...

    Tesla Motors (TSLA -4.5%) sold off after the Street failed to be impressed by the unveiling (video) of its Model X crossover, gull-wing doors and all. The Model X, a niche product even within the luxury car market until vehicle charging stations become more widespread, won't enter production until 2013, and will carry a price tag between $50K and $75K.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:15 PM | 4 Comments
  • HMST

    After finally going through with its delayed IPO (previously), HomeStreet (NASDAQ:HMST) finishes...

    After finally going through with its delayed IPO (previously), HomeStreet (NASDAQ:HMST) finishes its first day of trading at $48, up 9.1% from an IPO price of $44. The northwestern bank, which sold 1.8M shares in its offering, generated net income of $9.1M over the first 9 months of 2011, an improvement from a loss of $19.9M in the year-ago period. (S-1)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:56 PM
  • SLGN

    Silgan Holdings (SLGN -1.8%) closed lower after Baird cut the shares to Neutral on relative...

    Silgan Holdings (SLGN -1.8%) closed lower after Baird cut the shares to Neutral on relative valuation, recommending a swap into Sealed Air (SEE -3.3%), which was upgraded in turn to Outperform.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:52 PM
  • ITT

    ITT drops 2.6% AH after pushing back its Q4 earnings release date by two weeks to Feb. 29,...

    ITT drops 2.6% AH after pushing back its Q4 earnings release date by two weeks to Feb. 29, blaming the "complexities and time required" to review its finances following the spinoff of its defense and water business. ITT does, however, report its 2011 revenue was $2.1B (may not be comparable with a consensus of $2.21B).
     
     
     
     
    | 4:49 PM
  • MFC

    Manulife Financial (MFC -1.7%) ends the day lower after CIBC cut the shares to Sector Performer...

    Manulife Financial (MFC -1.7%) ends the day lower after CIBC cut the shares to Sector Performer after trimming its FY EPS and book-value estimates. The firm notes Q4 profit disappointed, largely because new-business strain-costs related to writing new policies.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:29 PM
  • LO

    Shares of Lorillard (LO -1.4%) give back some today after Stifel Nicolaus cut the stock to hold...

    Shares of Lorillard (LO -1.4%) give back some today after Stifel Nicolaus cut the stock to hold on valuation, saying it sees limited upside after yesterday's 9.7% move to the upside on the back of its solid Q4 report.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:17 PM
  • CPST

    Capstone Turbine (CPST -10%) takes a hit today after its FQ3 misses estimates on higher EPS...

    Capstone Turbine (CPST -10%) takes a hit today after its FQ3 misses estimates on higher EPS losses despite a 13% rise in overall revenue. The company logged fewer shipments for the quarter, which was offset somewhat by higher per unit revenue, but operational losses due to higher expenses weighed heavier than expected on bottom line margins.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:00 PM
  • LUFK

    Though Lufkin Industries (LUFK -4.6%) posted a decent Q4, Global Hunter lowers shares to Neutral...

    Though Lufkin Industries (LUFK -4.6%) posted a decent Q4, Global Hunter lowers shares to Neutral from Buy, saying "current valuation will need to hit its marks over the next several quarters for investors to become more comfortable with the earnings progression and 2013 estimates"; that could be difficult given the recent acquisition, international expansion and labor issues.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:55 PM
  • NYX

    NYSE Euronext (NYX +4.1%) moves higher after its Q4 earnings beat and detailing a plan to...

    NYSE Euronext (NYX +4.1%) moves higher after its Q4 earnings beat and detailing a plan to cut expenses, expand electronic trading services and apply a more disciplined approach to capital management. Further dealmaking also remains on the table in the wake of the scuttled merger with Deutsche Boerse. FT considers a potential alliance with LCH.Clearnet.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:45 PM
  • CIE

    Howard Weil adds its two-cents to Cobalt (CIE +31%) today, upgrading it to Outperform on the...

    Howard Weil adds its two-cents to Cobalt (CIE +31%) today, upgrading it to Outperform on the back of its successful test results off the coast of Angola.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:40 PM
  • GDI

    Gardner Denver (GDI -8.8%) drops after reporting a mixed Q4, beating on its EPS but missing on...

    Gardner Denver (GDI -8.8%) drops after reporting a mixed Q4, beating on its EPS but missing on revenue. Net earnings rose 36% Y/Y as the maker of air compressors and pumps benefited from strong demand in the energy sector, overall revenue growth fell short of expectations. The company also guided FY12 towards the lower end of expectations.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:12 PM
  • ALXN

    Alexion Pharmaceuticals (ALXN +3%) extends gains after its solid Q4 beat, and Baird raises the...

    Alexion Pharmaceuticals (ALXN +3%) extends gains after its solid Q4 beat, and Baird raises the stock to Outperform with a target of $100 from $72. The firm thinks shares will continue to work higher so long as estimates are increasing and clinical events remain positive, seeing sizable upside to consensus and several meaningful pipeline readouts this year.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:11 PM
  • GCI

    Gannett (GCI -2.8%) is offering early retirement packages to 665 employees in its U.S....

    Gannett (GCI -2.8%) is offering early retirement packages to 665 employees in its U.S. publishing division, as part of its ongoing efforts to pare costs amid advertising declines at its newspapers and lower revenue from its television business.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:00 PM
  • TRI

    Thomson Reuters (TRI -3.6%) is downgraded to Buy from Action List Buy with a target price cut to...

    Thomson Reuters (TRI -3.6%) is downgraded to Buy from Action List Buy with a target price cut to C$33 from C$43 at TD Securities. The firm sees TRI shares at an attractive entry point for long-term investors, but urges patience with European economic uncertainty and negative net sales in the market division in H2 2011. (Q4 earnings)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:59 PM
  • AGN

    Watson Pharmaceuticals (WPI -0.2%) faces a lawsuit from Bayer (OTCPK:BAYRY) over accusations...

    Watson Pharmaceuticals (WPI -0.2%) faces a lawsuit from Bayer (OTCPK:BAYRY) over accusations that it violated the drug maker's birth control patents, according to Bloomberg.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:58 PM
  • MPWR

    Monolithic Power Systems (MPWR +5.7%) ramps up after its Q4 beats across the board. Revenue was...

    Monolithic Power Systems (MPWR +5.7%) ramps up after its Q4 beats across the board. Revenue was esentially flat Y/Y but the company upped its FQ1 forecast, now expecting revenues of $46M - $50M, better than the Street view of $44M.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:57 PM
  • APO

    Apollo Global Management (APO -7.1%) drops after its Q4 missed estimates. Profit slid 95% Y/Y as...

    Apollo Global Management (APO -7.1%) drops after its Q4 missed estimates. Profit slid 95% Y/Y as the buyout firm reported a big decline in economic net income, a key metric because it includes both unrealized gains and employee compensation.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:41 PM
  • OSIR

    Osiris Therapeutics (OSIR -5.2%) slips after a flareup with Sanofi over a sudden termination on...

    Osiris Therapeutics (OSIR -5.2%) slips after a flareup with Sanofi over a sudden termination on an agreement to develop and commercialize Genzyme. Also adding to today's negative sentiment is the decision of JPMorgan to drop coverage on the stock.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:37 PM
  • AB

    Shares of AllianceBernstein (AB -8.9%) trade lower after the company misses the estimate of...

    Shares of AllianceBernstein (AB -8.9%) trade lower after the company misses the estimate of analysts with its Q4 earnings report. The investment firm saw a sharp falloff in trading activity due to risk aversion from equity investors and lost 15.1% of its assets under management over the last year.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:29 PM
  • PBR

    Petrobras (PBR -7.9%) shares slide after reporting a sharp drop in earnings and a management...

    Petrobras (PBR -7.9%) shares slide after reporting a sharp drop in earnings and a management shakeup. Q4 net profit fell to 5.05B Brazilian reais ($2.93B) from 10.6B reais a year ago due to supply chain problems which led to a production decline. Also, several high-level executives were replaced following the appointment of a new chief executive.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:29 PM | 3 Comments
  • LGF.A

    Down yesterday following its FQ3 miss, Lions Gate (LGF +8.8%) has reversed course, as the Street...

    Down yesterday following its FQ3 miss, Lions Gate (LGF +8.8%) has reversed course, as the Street overlooks weak movie revenue in a quarter that featured no major releases, and instead focuses on a growing backlog and an 80% Y/Y increase in digital revenue (likely Netflix-driven). Chris Katje recently praised the strength of Lions Gate's release schedule, following its deal to acquire Summit Entertainment.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:20 PM
  • FLIR

    Shares of Flir (FLIR -2.87%) are lower today after posting a mixed Q4, beating on a per share...

    Shares of Flir (FLIR -2.87%) are lower today after posting a mixed Q4, beating on a per share basis but falling short on revenue. Profit fell 8% Y/Y due to declines in the night-vision goggle maker's government systems and surveillance segments. The company also lowered revenue guidance below Wall Street's consensus, saying 2012 revenue will be in the range of $1.55B to $1.65B. The Street view is for $1.67B.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:09 PM
  • SBH

    Sally Beauty (SBH +3.5%) gains on an upgrade to Outperform at RBC Capital. The firm cites strong...

    Sally Beauty (SBH +3.5%) gains on an upgrade to Outperform at RBC Capital. The firm cites strong same-store-sales expectations for the coming quarter plus opportunities for international growth.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:47 PM
  • CBOE

    CBOE Holdings (CBOE +5.5%) treks higher after S&P decides to add the company to its S&P MidCap...

    CBOE Holdings (CBOE +5.5%) treks higher after S&P decides to add the company to its S&P MidCap 400 Index to replace Temple-Inland.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:41 PM
  • IOC

    Shares of InterOil (IOC -1.3%) head down on reports of some negative comments made by investor...

    Shares of InterOil (IOC -1.3%) head down on reports of some negative comments made by investor Whitney Tilson. InterOil has become a bit of a battleground stock with shorts like Tilson piling on with stinging claims against the company, while the bullish side asks for data to back up the allegations.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:28 PM
  • CGNX

    Cognex (CGNX -5.2%) Q4 results beat analysts' expectations on both EPS and revenue, but the...

    Cognex (CGNX -5.2%) Q4 results beat analysts' expectations on both EPS and revenue, but the company issued lowered revenue guidance for FQ1, now expecting revenue of $74M - $77M. Street estimates are for revenue of $79M.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:22 PM
  • XCO

    EXCO Resources (XCO -1.8%) drifts lower after Baird downgrades the shares to Neutral, citing the...

    EXCO Resources (XCO -1.8%) drifts lower after Baird downgrades the shares to Neutral, citing the effects of rising gas prices on current deman and potentially diminished cash flows.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:07 PM | 2 Comments
  • NOK

    Alcatel-Lucent (ALU +13.4%) rallies after exceeding Q4 EPS estimates and announcing plans to...

    Alcatel-Lucent (ALU +13.4%) rallies after exceeding Q4 EPS estimates and announcing plans to monetize its giant patent portfolio. With shares trading near historic lows, investors are willing to look past a 16% drop in telecom division revenue, which includes a 23% decline in mobile infrastructure sales. Free cash flow for seasonally strong Q4 was $713.7M, a figure that might be calming liquidity fears.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:03 PM
  • MOVE

    Real estate site owner Move (MOVE +16.5%) surges beating Q4 EPS forecasts. A 500 bps Y/Y...

    Real estate site owner Move (MOVE +16.5%) surges beating Q4 EPS forecasts. A 500 bps Y/Y increase in Move's adjusted EBITDA margin, to 18%, helped drive the earnings beat. Move is guiding for 2012 revenue of $195M-$200M ($198M consensus), and an adjusted EBITDA margin of 14%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:48 PM
  • ELON

    Echelon Corporation (ELON -10.2%) takes a hit after posting a better Q4 but warning on FY12,...

    Echelon Corporation (ELON -10.2%) takes a hit after posting a better Q4 but warning on FY12, saying macro-related headwinds may make it difficult to land new European contracts. Dougherty & Company downgrades the shares to Neutral on the results.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:44 PM
  • MLCO

    Melco Crown (MPEL -2.1%) trades down after Deutsche cut the shares to hold earlier today on...

    Melco Crown (MPEL -2.1%) trades down after Deutsche cut the shares to hold earlier today on valuation, citing the stocks +40% run since mid-December.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:37 PM
  • NUAN

    Nuance (NUAN -13.4%), whose shares had nearly doubled since August, is off sharply after its FQ1...

    Nuance (NUAN -13.4%), whose shares had nearly doubled since August, is off sharply after its FQ1 report (I, II) raises fears that Apple's Siri may not be as profitable as hoped. Wedbush (Underperform) notes Nuance's top-line miss occurred in spite of the acquisition of Vlingo. Needham (Buy), however, is optimistic attempts by phone vendors to catch up to Siri will drive demand for Nuance's software. (transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 12:21 PM | 1 Comment
  • ORLY

    O'Reilly Automotive (ORLY -1%) drifts lower after being cut to Hold on valuation at Deutsche...

    O'Reilly Automotive (ORLY -1%) drifts lower after being cut to Hold on valuation at Deutsche Bank, saying that improving new car sales and economic indicators may weigh against the company's comp growth in 2013 and reduce upside potential over the near term.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:13 PM
  • PROJ

    Deltek (PROJ +2.1%) gains despite posting a mixed Q4, beating on a per share basis but coming up...

    Deltek (PROJ +2.1%) gains despite posting a mixed Q4, beating on a per share basis but coming up just shy of revenue estimates. Q4 product revenue was strong however, at $29M, up 12% from Q4 2010. Wells Fargo ups its rating on the shares to Outperform on the back of the results and raises its target range to $12-$14.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:01 PM
  • AMRS

    Amyris (AMRS -28%) shares sink after the renewable products company says it's no longer...

    Amyris (AMRS -28%) shares sink after the renewable products company says it's no longer forecasting positive cash flow for 2012 and will instead seek as much as $60M in additional financing. AMRS is running into execution risk as it scales up its production of next-generation biofuels, Raymond James says: "It will clearly take time for the growth curve to materialize."

     
     
     
     
    | 11:56 AM | 1 Comment
  • UNFI

    Shares of United Natural Foods (UNFI -5.9%) swoon after OTR Global warns that the company is in...

    Shares of United Natural Foods (UNFI -5.9%) swoon after OTR Global warns that the company is in danger of losing supermarket accounts.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:51 AM
  • AABA

    Yahoo (YHOO +1.9%) trades higher following news of Alibaba's (OTC:ALBCF) latest efforts to...

    Yahoo (YHOO +1.9%) trades higher following news of Alibaba's (OTC:ALBCF) latest efforts to facilitate a deal. According to Reuters, Yahoo may hold onto a 15% stake in Alibaba following the deal's closing. In addition, instead of procuring third-party assets as part of the deal, as has been previously reported, Alibaba may offer a stake in Alibaba.com and/or other company-owned assets.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:43 AM
  • SYNC

    Synacor (NASDAQ:SYNC) is changing hands at $5.85, up 17% from an IPO price of $5. Synacor, whose...

    Synacor (NASDAQ:SYNC) is changing hands at $5.85, up 17% from an IPO price of $5. Synacor, whose web portal software powers the TV Everywhere initiatives of cable providers, generated revenue of $62.1M (+29% Y/Y) over the first 9 months of 2011, and net income of $2.2M. The company recently acquired Carbyn, a developer of a cloud-based OS that uses HTML5 technology. (S-1 filing) (previously)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:25 AM
  • HERO

    Hercules Offshore (HERO +5.2%) gains after being upped to Buy at Pritchard on the back if its...

    Hercules Offshore (HERO +5.2%) gains after being upped to Buy at Pritchard on the back if its strong Q4 results yesterday, citing improving Gulf of Mexico demand and dayrates.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:25 AM
  • FSLR

    First Solar (FSLR -8.5%) is cut to Neutral from Buy at Collins Stewart, which cites risks around...

    First Solar (FSLR -8.5%) is cut to Neutral from Buy at Collins Stewart, which cites risks around a California facility after payment on a $646M Department of Energy loan is held up over a construction permit. "FSLR will not be able to recognize revenues from Antelope Valley construction unless a sale is completed and funded," analyst Dan Ries writes.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:12 AM
  • RYL

    FBN Securities cuts five homebuilders on valuation today, saying the sector's strong move since...

    FBN Securities cuts five homebuilders on valuation today, saying the sector's strong move since August may have run its course. It cuts Ryland Group (RYL -0.8%) to Sector Perform, and Lennar (LEN -1.5%), Beazer Homes (BZH -2.6%), Hovnanian (HOV -5%) and Standard Pacific (SPF -0.9%) all to Underperform.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:06 AM
  • SLXP

    Salix Pharmaceuticals (SLXP -7.7%) plunges after the FDA provides relatively lenient clinical...

    Salix Pharmaceuticals (SLXP -7.7%) plunges after the FDA provides relatively lenient clinical study guidelines (.pdf) for would-be makers of a generic version of Salix's Xifaxan drug. Salix closed yesterday near its 52-week high.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:02 AM
  • XOM

    Shares of oil explorers and integrated companies (XLE -1%) tumble after the IEA chops its oil...

    Shares of oil explorers and integrated companies (XLE -1%) tumble after the IEA chops its oil demand forecast for the sixth straight month; the new forecast implies demand will grow less than 1% in 2012. XOM -1.2%, CVX -1.4%. Nymex crude -1.5% to $98.34.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:59 AM
  • GSE

    GSE Holding (NYSE:GSE), a maker of geosynthetic liners for a variety of industries, is trading...

    GSE Holding (NYSE:GSE), a maker of geosynthetic liners for a variety of industries, is trading at $11.10, up 23.3% from today's IPO price of $9. GSE, which sold 7M shares, generated revenue of $353.8M (+40% Y/Y) over the first 9 months of 2011, and net income of $1.9M. (S-1 filing)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:45 AM
  • FLO

    Flowers Foods (FLO -4.3%) Q4 earnings fell 27% as higher ingredient costs offset a sales...

    Flowers Foods (FLO -4.3%) Q4 earnings fell 27% as higher ingredient costs offset a sales improvement helped by last year's acquisition of Tasty Baking. Results missed estimates, with EPS at $0.17 vs. consensus $0.21; the maker of Nature’s Own, Sunbeam and Blue Bird breads and baked goods also issued a cautious 2012 outlook.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:44 AM | 1 Comment
  • RLOG

    Rand Logistics (RLOG +4.5%) trades higher after reporting better-than-expected FQ3 earnings, led...

    Rand Logistics (RLOG +4.5%) trades higher after reporting better-than-expected FQ3 earnings, led by a 31% Y/Y gain in marine freight revenue. CEO Laurence Levy tips off that the firm is also showing strength in FQ4, as it operated for an above-average 203 sailing days in Jan.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:44 AM
  • MASI

    Masimo (MASI -3.2%) dips after being cut to Sell from Neutral at Citigroup on on concerns over...

    Masimo (MASI -3.2%) dips after being cut to Sell from Neutral at Citigroup on on concerns over margin compression and limited adoption of its technology among hospital customers.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:43 AM
  • ATVI

    Activision (ATVI -2.5%) is downgraded to Neutral with a reduced price target of $14 from $16 by...

    Activision (ATVI -2.5%) is downgraded to Neutral with a reduced price target of $14 from $16 by Macquarie, which notes declining revenue from World of Warcraft, increased spending and "continued reliance" on the blockbuster Call of Duty franchise as risks. The ATVI pipeline is strong, but the firm "came away from [Q4 results] feeling less confident on the near term."

     
     
     
     
    | 10:36 AM | 1 Comment
  • AKS

    AK Steel (AKS -4.2%) gets hit after being downgraded to Neutral at Citigroup, citing a lack of...

    AK Steel (AKS -4.2%) gets hit after being downgraded to Neutral at Citigroup, citing a lack of pricing power in stainless steel after North American Stainless decided to maintain base prices at historic lows.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:21 AM
  • NGSX

    NeurogesX (NASDAQ:NGSX) -20.6% after yesterday's news that an FDA advisory committee did not...

    NeurogesX (NASDAQ:NGSX) -20.6% after yesterday's news that an FDA advisory committee did not recommend approval for its Qutenza patch as a treatment for nerve pain related to HIV-associated peripheral neuropathy.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:20 AM
  • IPGP

    IPG Photonics (IPGP +8%) soars after posting Q4 results. Though the industrial laser vendor's...

    IPG Photonics (IPGP +8%) soars after posting Q4 results. Though the industrial laser vendor's top-line figure missed estimates, its guidance for Q1 revenue of $115M-$125M and EPS of $0.56-$0.64 (consensus of $115.8M and $0.54) is going over well with investors concerned about softening Euro and Chinese demand. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:15 AM
  • VIAV

    JDS Uniphase (JDSU +1.8%) catches a bid after Credit Suisse's William Stein upgrades shares to...

    JDS Uniphase (JDSU +1.8%) catches a bid after Credit Suisse's William Stein upgrades shares to Outperform. Stein sees room for margin improvement JDS' core telecom optical component and test equipment businesses, and thinks lesser-known products, such as industrial lasers, gesture-tracking components (used in the Kinect), and color-shifting inks, can drive upside. (previously)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:06 AM
  • PYX

    Tobacco merchant Alliance One (AOI +3.1%) pops to a 6-month high after reporting FQ3 EPS of...

    Tobacco merchant Alliance One (AOI +3.1%) pops to a 6-month high after reporting FQ3 EPS of $0.13 vs. a loss of $0.02 last year. Quarterly revenues declined 5.4% to $493.9M due to the timing of shipments and a decline in crop prices. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:00 AM
  • NOK

    Alcatel-Lucent (ALU +14.4%) says it is working with RPX Corp. (RPXC +7.2%) on a plan to license...

    Alcatel-Lucent (ALU +14.4%) says it is working with RPX Corp. (RPXC +7.2%) on a plan to license its portfolio of ~29,000 patents in areas such as fixed and wireless communications, semiconductors and network security. RPX buys and licenses patents and helps big companies avoid patent lawsuits; ALU expects to earn several hundred million euros from the arrangement.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:53 AM
  • MSFT

    In spite of a lofty valuation, LinkedIn (LNKD +12.3%) is surging after posting strong Q4 results...

    In spite of a lofty valuation, LinkedIn (LNKD +12.3%) is surging after posting strong Q4 results and 2012 guidance, as well as a healthy jump in registered users. Canaccord is impressed with the performance of the Hiring Solutions business, noting it added 1,870 corporate customers. During its earnings call, LinkedIn mentioned the strong uptake seen for its mobile apps, and said it would begin selling mobile ads soon.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:47 AM
  • EA

    Electronic Arts (EA -3.9%) shares are downgraded to Neutral with a reduced price target of $18...

    Electronic Arts (EA -3.9%) shares are downgraded to Neutral with a reduced price target of $18 from $25 at Macquarie, which cites factors such as "the continued talent drain of key management," weak industry sales and "very limited visibility" into the trends for the recently launched Star Wars: The Old Republic. The firm sees "more uncertainty than warrants an Outperform rating."

     
     
     
     
    | 9:43 AM
  • AONEQ

    A123 Systems (AONE +5.1%) announces that it landed a deal to supply a U.K. grid operator with...

    A123 Systems (AONE +5.1%) announces that it landed a deal to supply a U.K. grid operator with six lithium ion storage systems. The firm aims to step into markets similar to that in the U.K. that want to go with renewable choices - but face wind and solar power constraints.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:41 AM
  • MSFT

    U.S. retail video game hardware and software sales each fell 38% Y/Y in January, claims NPD, an...

    U.S. retail video game hardware and software sales each fell 38% Y/Y in January, claims NPD, an ugly showing even after accounting for the ages of the major consoles, and likely further evidence of the impact made by mobile and social gaming. In December, the Y/Y declines were only 28% and 14%, respectively. The Xbox 360 (NASDAQ:MSFT) was again the top-selling home console; its 270K shipments gave it a 49% share. GME -2.3%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:29 AM
  • OSGB

    Overseas Shipholding (NYSE:OSG) says it will suspend quarterly dividend payments, the latest...

    Overseas Shipholding (NYSE:OSG) says it will suspend quarterly dividend payments, the latest step by the shipper to preserve liquidity. OSG has posted significant losses, as a slump in tanker rates has hurt its top line; high fuel costs also have pressured profitability. Shares -11.2% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:25 AM
  • TRLG

    At least three downgrades so far on True Religion (NASDAQ:TRLG) after posting Q4 EPS and revenue...

    At least three downgrades so far on True Religion (NASDAQ:TRLG) after posting Q4 EPS and revenue well below expectations and issuing downward 2012 guidance. Benchmark believes TRLG has a spending problem, not a revenue problem; the apparel company has "intentionally held back revenues to protect the brand." Brean Murray says TRLG needs to "rebuild credibility." Shares -20.8% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:59 AM | 1 Comment
  • WYNN

    Both sides claim victory over a judge's ruling that Wynn Resorts (NASDAQ:WYNN) must prove...

    Both sides claim victory over a judge's ruling that Wynn Resorts (NASDAQ:WYNN) must prove "reasonable" access to Kazuo Okada's team to inspect documents in a bitter legal tangle between the two once-friends who own 30% of Wynn between them. Shares of WYNN tip 1.2% lower premarket, as analysts continue to warn that the in-fighting is a short-term drag.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:59 AM
